intro: Pleurogynella brachyanthera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pleurogynella, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open woodlands and heathlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
